meanings.definition: In a manner involving lying under oath or giving false testimony.
meanings.sent1: He perjuriously claimed to have seen the crime happen.
meanings.sent2: She perjuriously denied any involvement in the scandal.
meanings.sent3: The cat perjuriously insisted it was the dog who knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The politician perjuriously promised to lower taxes if elected.
meanings.sent5: The witness perjuriously pointed to the wrong suspect in court.

meanings.definition: In a deceitful or dishonest manner.
meanings.sent1: The scammer perjuriously convinced people to invest in his fake company.
meanings.sent2: He perjuriously altered the contract to benefit himself.
meanings.sent3: The student perjuriously claimed the dog ate his homework.
meanings.sent4: The con artist perjuriously posed as a wealthy businessman to gain trust.
meanings.sent5: The thief perjuriously denied stealing the valuable painting.
